701151f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 162nd Street (East)
701151f-a.text:
Grand Concourse, north from East 162nd Street, showing (left)
Joyce Kilner Park during improvement activities. The two frame
buildings in the foreground are stables on the estate of Robert Simpson,
at the S.E. corner of East 163rd Street. Also shown is a panoramic
view northwestward, the vantage-point being the 10-story Concourse Plaza
building, at the N.E. corner of Grand Concourse and East 161st Street.
May 1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

701152f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 162nd Street (East)
701152f-a.text:
Grand Concourse (foreground), at the N.E. corner of East 162nd Street,
showing the Robert Simpson Mansion (E. Robinson's map of 1885).
May 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

701153f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 162nd Street (East)
701153f-a.text:
Grand Concourse, east side, north from East 162nd Street. At the
S.E. corner of East 163rd Street, appears the servant's cottage of
the Robert Simpson family. The main house being at the N.E. corner
of East 162nd Street (E. Robinson's map of 1885).
May 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The Same, at a later date. Note the clearance extending from
East 162nd to 163rd Streets which was created by the demolition of
the two houses of Robert Simpson. Across the lot appears the East
163rd Street side of No. 940, the Concourse Gardens South.
July 7, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
